page.title: 16Greenhill Lodge Farm
page.content: We visted{Greenhill Lodge}Farm,a 240 acre farm lying between the Bull's Head and Copt Oak,and run by Mr.Bower, a tenant farmer.On the farm there were 63 cows,300 sheep to shear and 370 lambs. The sheep were either{Romney}or Romney cross but Mr. Bower kept 3 {Leicester}sheep,1 ram and 2 ewes, because of their "very exceptional" wool. All the cows were numbered and were mainly Friesian.If a cow had to be replaced it would cost Mr. Bower at least Â£500 and possibly Â£700.At that price they would only be average animals.The cows were not kept for meat but for their milk yield,and produced 11,000 gallons of milk a year.Near the cow sheds was a large metal structure which held cow cake.
